12:29 <tmortagne> mflorea: any idea what might be the cause for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg-6.4.x/lastBuild/testReport/ ? it's not listed in known flickering test as far as I can see and it's failing since about 1 month  
12:29 <tmortagne> (hard to tell exactly since we don't have the first failing built in the history anymore)  
12:30 <tmortagne> the age since very close to 2 other failing test on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.4.x/lastBuild/testReport/  
12:30 <tmortagne> seems  
12:30 <ekarlso> is there facebook / openid login for xwiki ?  
12:32 <tmortagne> ekarlso: that would be trough http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Social+Login+Application extension  
12:32 <ekarlso> tmortagne: you mean it's hard ?  
12:33 <tmortagne> I means it's not by default but you have this extension that does it  
12:33 <tmortagne> it's just that this extension is not supported by the core team and not very active if you have bugs  
12:33 <ekarlso> ah ok :)=  
12:33 <tmortagne> but it's supposed to work AFAIK  
12:34 <ekarlso> trying to figure out how I can do SSO with Xwiki and some other stuff  
12:34 <ekarlso> suggestions ?  
12:36 <mflorea> tmortagne: from the screenshot it seems the finder has too many results and the blog home page is not included:  
12:36 <mflorea> \* because it's not among the first 6 results (although it should)  
12:37 <mflorea> I would test on a clean 6.4.x if the search for "Wiki Blog" includes the home page in the first 6 results  
12:50 <ClemensR> ekarlso: maybe try if the CAS - authenticator still works: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Authenticator+Jasig+CAS  
12:50 <ClemensR> it should, but I have to admit it is quite some time till I tested it  
12:50 <ekarlso> seems I'm getting freebie access to supported ForgeRock  
12:50 <ekarlso> :p  
13:25 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <msmeria> has quit  
13:39 <cthiel> I'm wondering about the status of https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-ckeditor / http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration  
13:40 <cthiel> is CKEditor going to replace the current WYSIWYG editor in xwiki or is this a (mostly?) abandoned idea?  
13:46 <cthiel> mflorea: ^^  
13:48 <mflorea> cthiel: it will, but in 8.x. We're planing to stat working on this at the beginning on the next year (2016)  
13:49 <cthiel> mflorea: cool! so it's a good idea to start testing / using the xwiki-contrib ext?  
13:50 <mflorea> yes, we'll stat the integration from this extension  
13:50 <mflorea> s/stat/start  
13:50 <mflorea> i.e. we're going to build on top of the current extension  
14:47 <OSIMasson> has quit  
15:04 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:05 <woshilapin> Hi devs  
15:06 <woshilapin> I'm trying to access User profiles from a Java code and I usually think like I would do in Velocity (services.query then Xwiki.getDocument().getObject)  
15:06 <woshilapin> Is there a better way to do that?  
15:07 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <tmortagne> woshilapin: you should use QueryManager component instead of services.query but appart from this that's pretty much it, there is no user oriented API  
15:08 <woshilapin> OK, thanks :-)  
15:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <flashdel> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <flashdel> hi! I am using xwiki 7.2, everything works perfecly, but i got one wuestion: If i share a site via E-Mail the url in that email is set to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ but it should be http://mydomain.de/xwiki/bin/view/Main How can i change this?  
16:08 <D-Spair> has quit  
16:10 <Inge-> Is it actually using port 8080 in the email while listening on port 80?  
16:18 <ClemensR> there is likely some proxy information missing. the frontend server should pass the infomation that XWiki is proxied, and then it should be fine  
16:18 <flashdel> ahhh found it, i had to set xwiki.home= in xwiki.cfg  
16:19 <ClemensR> ah, ok :)  
16:19 <flashdel> it runs on localhost, but gets proxy\_passed, so that parameter has to exist  
16:23 <vmassol> has quit  
16:25 <tmortagne> flashdel: xwiki.home property is kind of a last resort property, in standard as ClemensR explain XWiki is supposed to deduce it from the URL requesting it but that imply the proxy is properly configured to let all information pass trough  
16:28 <ClemensR> what might confuse it is that the very first request comes from http://localhost:8080 ... i.e. internal cron job, and the e-mail sending job remembers this, due to lack of other information  
16:32 <ClemensR> if that is the case, you might have to hardwire the "proper" value in xwiki.home=... just to make sure  
16:35 <tmortagne> yes cron stuff is the usual use case that might cause force to use this property  
16:36 <tmortagne> but only if the crong request is the very first request  
16:36 <tmortagne> s/crong/cron/  
16:36 <tmortagne> but that's mostly for main wiki, for other wikis what is used most of the time is the wiki descriptor  
16:38 <flashdel> tmortagne: i am just using one wiki, so i guess its no problem if i configure it that way?  
16:39 <tmortagne> flashdel: it's not that much of a probleme but it usually means your the proxy in front of XWiki is not properly configured since that property is supposed to be useless  
16:39 <tmortagne> maybe some extension or other feature not related to URL generation need to get the right request URL  
16:44 <flashdel> tmortagne: ok i will keep that in mind, thanks!  
17:08 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
17:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <iamchrisf> has quit  
17:47 <tmortagne> Enygma`: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/90e2bed48f51a073f761bf557cd6dd7fb8f38bd9#commitcomment-14188335  
17:47 <tmortagne> should I remove it ?  
17:48 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <vmassol> good morning (well morning here ;))  
17:51 <vmassol> do we have an ETA for the RC1 release?  
17:52 <vmassol> btw ci.xwiki.org is taking a long time to load for me  
17:52 <vmassol> (maybe the upgrade caused the same problem we had before; ie ci gets slower and slower as history builds up)  
17:53 <vmassol> (the home page is now in cache so it should load fast for you ;))  
17:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not slower than before the upgrade for me  
17:55 <vmassol> ok, we need to monitor, I didn't remember the home page being so slow to load for me  
17:55 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes, please  
17:55 <Enygma`> thanks  
17:55 <vmassol> (took 1-2 minutes)  
17:55 <tmortagne> it's slow when you access something for the first time in a while, always did
